channel.title: Comments on: Map of Online Communities

item.title: By: Karte der Online Community | Wissen belastet
item.dc:creator: Karte der Online Community | Wissen belastet
item.description: [...] Gefunden auf einem meiner Lieblingsblogs, AFKGamer. Share This [...]
item.content:encoded: […] Gefunden auf einem meiner Lieblingsblogs, AFKGamer. Share This […]

item.title: By: Rose
item.dc:creator: Rose
item.description:
Scary, simply scary. MySpace is a monstrosity.
The thing the map fails to take into account is that some people "inhabit" these islands concurrently. For example, a Lineage II player who hangs out on IRC, contributes to YouTube, has a Flickr and a Facebook account, and dabbles in DeviantArt.
The day that someone shows that connection between and across networks... well, that's the day privacy died. So I hope it never happens. ;)
item.content:encoded:
Scary, simply scary. MySpace is a monstrosity.

The thing the map fails to take into account is that some people “inhabit” these islands concurrently. For example, a Lineage II player who hangs out on IRC, contributes to YouTube, has a Flickr and a Facebook account, and dabbles in DeviantArt.

The day that someone shows that connection between and across networks… well, that’s the day privacy died. So I hope it never happens. ðŸ˜‰

item.title: By: Heather
item.dc:creator: Heather
item.description: Gamers are isolated from the bay of angst? What? Then what's all that damn complaining I keep seeing in games that makes me constantly leave certain channels because I develop an overwhelming urge to strangle the next person who complains about some minor game issue as though it's worse than world war 3?
item.content:encoded: Gamers are isolated from the bay of angst? What? Then what’s all that damn complaining I keep seeing in games that makes me constantly leave certain channels because I develop an overwhelming urge to strangle the next person who complains about some minor game issue as though it’s worse than world war 3?

item.title: By: Ratmaggot
item.dc:creator: Ratmaggot
item.description: Funny, I just blogged about this map myself. It is pretty cool but I really would have thought WoW was *not* bigger than Flickr!
item.content:encoded: Funny, I just blogged about this map myself. It is pretty cool but I really would have thought WoW was *not* bigger than Flickr!

item.title: By: Gemma

item.description: Lol thats awesome. Only thing I wonder about....Google is really that small??
item.content:encoded: Lol thats awesome. Only thing I wonder about….Google is really that small??

item.title: By: Zubon
item.dc:creator: Zubon
item.description:
xkcd.com answers all the important questions: Q: How often does the algorithm find Jesus? A: <a href="http://www.xkcd.com"/ rel="nofollow">The algorithm constantly finds Jesus</a>.
Q: How can it do that? A: <a href="http://www.xkcd.com"/ rel="nofollow">The algorithm is from Jersey</a>.
Q: Wow, people from Jersey can do that? Even in China? A: No. <a href="http://www.xkcd.com"/ rel="nofollow">The algorithm is banned in China</a>.
Q: What, why? A: <a href="http://www.xkcd.com"/ rel="nofollow">The algorithm killed Jeeves</a>.
Q: But why would the algorithm do that? A: Please read <a href="http://blag.xkcd.com/2007/04/19/billboards/" rel="nofollow">here</a> for an explanation.
item.content:encoded:
xkcd.com answers all the important questions:
Q: How often does the algorithm find Jesus?
A: The algorithm constantly finds Jesus.

Q: How can it do that?
A: The algorithm is from Jersey.

Q: Wow, people from Jersey can do that? Even in China?
A: No. The algorithm is banned in China.

Q: What, why?
A: The algorithm killed Jeeves.

Q: But why would the algorithm do that?
A: Please read here for an explanation.
